titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lawrence Stelter Brooklyn photograph collection V1989.025
titlestmt.author: Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:21:02 +0000.

physdesc.extent: five items contained in one folder.

did.abstract: The collection includes two photographs showing houses on Beverley Road in Brooklyn; a photograph showing two unidentified children standing outside of a large house; a photograph of a boy on roller skates holding a hockey stick and standing in front of a car on a sidewalk; a photograph of two unidentified adults standing on a residential sidewalk in front a parked car; and one 8" x 10" print of an unidentified woman sitting on a bench located along the boardwalk in front of the Brighton Hotel in Brighton Beach.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Lawrence Stelter Brooklyn photograph collection consists of six black-and-white photographic prints dating from circa 1930 to 1939. The collection includes two photographs showing houses on Beverley Road in Brooklyn; a photograph showing two unidentified children standing outside of a large house; a photograph of a boy on roller skates holding a hockey stick and standing in front of a car on a sidewalk; a photograph of two unidentified adults standing on a residential sidewalk in front a parked car; and one 8" x 10" print of an unidentified woman sitting on a bench located along the boardwalk in front of the Brighton Hotel in Brighton Beach. It is not known if the people depicted in the photographs are related.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for anonymously created items remain in effect for 120 years following the date of creation. Based on the date range of this collection, items in this collection will enter the public domain in 2050. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library. Please consult library staff for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Lawrence Stelter Brooklyn photograph collection, V1989.025, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.
